member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.BacktesterExitStrategyContract.Original
member.summary: Original exit means that we just use the date when position was sold.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.BacktesterExitStrategyContract.Vq
member.summary: Exit by VQ means that we use VQ to determine exit date. If this exit signal is enabled, then ExitByVqParams field must be set.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.BacktesterExitStrategyContract.Ssi
member.summary: Exit by SSI means that we use SSI (Health) to determine exit date.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.BacktesterExitStrategyContract.TrailingStop
member.summary: Exit by Trailing Stop means that we sell position when it's current price X% lower than the highest price after purchase date. If this exit signal is enabled, then ExitByTrailingStopParams field must be set.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.BacktesterExitStrategyContract.VqParams
member.summary: Parameters to use 'Vq' exit strategy. Required only in case if ExitByVq strategy is set in ExitStrategy field.

member.name: M:TradeStops.Contracts.Mappers.PropertiesMapper.Map(System.Object,System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Fill all properties of destination object with values from matching properties of source object. ! Note: All properties must be simple types, like int, decimal, enum, string.
member.param: Destination object that you want to patch
Throw exception if matching property from destination object is not found in source object

Allow to map null value from source object to default value when destination property is not nullable. Example: source property "bool? UseIntraday = null", destination property "bool UseIntraday" will be set to default(bool) if parameter set to true, or exception will be thrown if parameter set to false

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.ProductSubscriptionsFeaturesContract
member.summary: Information about available features for one or many specified ProductSubscriptions. For multiple ProductSubscriptions it contains aggregated (summary) availability information. member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.PortfoliosCount
member.summary: Portfolio Management: Maximum number of portfolios that user can create (portfolios count by subscription + additional portfolios customization).

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.SyncPortfoliosCount
member.summary: Portfolio Management: Number of portfolios that can be imported from single brokerage account with one import. This value doesn't limit number of synchronized portfolios in user's account - we have PortfoliosCount for both manual and synchronized portfolios.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.AlertsCount
member.summary: Portfolio Management: Maximum number of alerts that user can create (alerts count by subscription + additional alerts customization).

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.Positions
member.summary: Portfolio Management: Indicates availability of positions for user. Used by Nightly Update to decide if it's necessary to process user's positions. This property has similar meaning to PortfoliosCount property, but it's preferable to use because it's boolean property (it's simpler).

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.AddStocks

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.CryptoExchange
member.summary: Determines whether user has access to crypto exchange or not. Used in UserSettings.ExchangesFlags + symbols autocomplete.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.StockExchanges
member.summary: Determines whether user has access to stock exchanges or not. Used in UserSettings.ExchangesFlags + symbols autocomplete.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.ImportPortfolios
member.summary: Determines if importing portfolio from Yodlee/Plaid is available for user.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.RefreshImportedPortfolios
member.summary: Determines if refreshing portfolio that was imported from Yodlee/Plaid is available for user. This feature is necessary mostly because of Portfolio Analyzer, where we allow to import portfolio, but we don't synchronize it unless the user buys paid subscription.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesContract.SyncPortfolioForCrypto
member.summary: Determines if the user can import/update crypto positions. If not available items are imported as unconfirmed. Moved out as a separate feature, because users with a Crypto Ideas subscription (CryptoFinder) are not able to import/refresh crypto positions. I do not know why. This is true for all users with any crypto subscription except Crypto Ideas. Nothing else is checked.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.UserFeaturesCustomizationContract
member.summary: Values to customize features for specified user. These permissions are applied additionally to subscription permissions, and remain unmodified even when subscription level is changed. So, if somebody enables any feature in Admin Area, then it will be enabled until somebody will disable it explicitly. This contract is the exact copy of the values that we have in the database. It is intended to be used only internally by API and AdminArea. Not null for existing user.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.CoveredCallTriggerContract
member.summary: Create a Covered Call Cost Basis Trigger that monitors the price of the Underlying Stock below or above the Cost Basis of the Option trade. Cost Basis equals the Entry Price of the purchased Stock minus the option's Entry Price per share. (For example, it monitors and notifies when the Latest Close is 25% below Cost Basis and I bought the Underlying Stock for $1.) A Covered Call Cost Basis Trigger is available only for Short Call options.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CoveredCallTriggerContract.PriceType
member.summary: Trigger price type. The only possible valid value is Close.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CoveredCallTriggerContract.ThresholdValue
member.summary: Percent value of the option Latest Close.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CoveredCallTriggerContract.OperationType
member.summary: Trigger operation types. Valid values are Less or Greater.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CoveredCallTriggerContract.StockPurchasePrice
member.summary: Price value of the Underlying Stock.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.NakedPutTriggerContract
member.summary: Create a Naked Put Cost Basis Trigger that monitors the price of the Underlying Stock below or above the Cost Basis of the Option trade. Cost Basis equals the Strike Price minus the option's Entry Price per share. (For example, it monitors and notifies when the Latest Close is 25% below Cost Basis.) A Naked Put Cost Basis Trigger is available only for Short Put options.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.CalendarDaysTriggerContract
member.summary: Create a Calendar Days After Entry Trigger that monitors a specific number of calendar days after the Entry Date of the position at which to be alerted. The Equal setting will trigger the alert once when the specified number of days is reached. The ModuleDeletion setting will trigger the alert every time when the specified number of days is reached.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CalendarDaysTriggerContract.OperationType
member.summary: Trigger operation types. Valid values are Equal or ModuleDeletion.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.CalendarDaysTriggerContract.ThresholdValue
member.summary: Number of the calendar days after position entry date .

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.ProfitableClosesTriggerContract
member.summary: Create a Profitable Closes After Entry Trigger that monitors a specific number of profitable Closes/Opens. The alert will be triggered when the number of profitable Closes/Opens between the current Close Date and the position Entry Date will be equal to the specified value.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.ProfitableClosesTriggerContract.PriceType
member.summary: Trigger profitable type. Valid values are Open or Close .

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.ProfitableClosesTriggerContract.ThresholdValue
member.summary: Number of profitable closes or opens.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.SpecificDateTriggerContract.ThresholdDate
member.summary: Date when the alert will be triggered.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.TradingDaysTriggerContract
member.summary: Create a Trading Days After Entry Trigger that monitors a specific number of trading days after the Entry Date of the position. Trading days are the days the market is open. The Equal setting will trigger the alert once when the specified number of trading days is reached. The ModuleDeletion setting will trigger the alert every time when the specified number of trading days is reached.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.TradingDaysTriggerContract.OperationType
member.summary: Trigger operation types. Valid values are Equal or ModuleDeletion.

member.name: P:TradeStops.Contracts.TradingDaysTriggerContract.ThresholdValue
member.summary: Number of the position trigger days .

member.summary: Create a Trailing Stop Percent Trigger based on the position entry date or a custom start date. Percentage trailing stops track the percent below the highest point of closing profitability since the entry date of the position. You can send a custom start price which will be used for setting up the highest Position Trigger price.

member.name: T:TradeStops.Contracts.Types.Optional`1
member.summary: Class is used in cases when you want to wrap any other class to indicate it's optional field in contract. It works almost like Nullable(T) type but for all classes, not only for value-types. Example of usage: when user sends data to TS API to edit (patch) some entity, we need to understand if a value was set to null explicitly or it was just not initialized. Check OptionalWrapperExtensions.WasSet() and ObjectExtensions.Wrap() methods also.
member.typeparam: Any reference type, nullable type, or value type

member.name: M:TradeStops.Contracts.Types.Optional`1.op_Implicit(`0)~TradeStops.Contracts.Types.Optional{`0}
member.param: value of T type to convert to Wrapper(T) type
